title: If the purchase price of 10 pens is equal to the selling price of 8 pens, what is the percentage of profit or loss? - Quora

response.answer_text: Statement of the given problem,If the purchase price of 10 pens is equal to the selling price of 8 pens, what is the percentage of profit or loss?Let C & S denote cost-price & sell-price of a pen respectively.Hence from above data we get following relation,8*S = 10*Cor S = (5/4)*Cor S = (1 + 1/4)*Cor S = (1 + 25/100)*CTherefore from above we determine thatthe percentage of profit = 25% [Ans]

Let us assume the Cost Price of a pen= 10So Cost Price of 10- pens= 100Therefore Sale price of 8- pens= 100So Sale price of 1- pen= 100/8=12.5Now Profit%= (S.P-C.P)/C.P x 100 =2.5/10 x 100= 25% .**No formulaClear Answer.
